title: Gina Raimondo
deleted: ==Speculation for Cabinet Position in Biden Administration==

Immediately after the election of Joe Biden, numerous media outlets speculated that Raimondo was a leading candidate for numerous cabinet positions. On December 2, 2020, [[Peter Alexander (journalist)|Peter Alexander]] of NBC News reported that Raimondo was a leading contender for the position of [[United States Secretary of Health and Human Services|secretary of health and human services]] in the [[Biden administration]], and multiple major news outlets subsequently confirmed the story.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Alexander|first=Peter|date=December 2, 2020|title=Leading contenders for Biden’s HHS Secretary, who could be named as soon as next week: @Vivek_Murthy, former Surgeon General & @GinaRaimondo, RI governor, I’m told.|url=https://twitter.com/PeterAlexander/status/1334186807555190784|url-status=live|archive-url=https://twitter.com/PeterAlexander/status/1334186807555190784|archive-date=December 3, 2020|access-date=December 3, 2020|website=Twitter}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|last=Rambaran|first=Vandana|date=December 2, 2020|title=Biden's HHS frontrunners say gun control is a health issue|work=Fox News|url=https://www.foxnews.com/politics/bidens-hhs-frontrunners-say-gun-control-is-a-health-issue|access-date=December 3, 2020}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|last=O'Keefe|first=Ed|date=December 2, 2020|title=Pressure intensifies as Biden weighs 3 top Cabinet picks|work=CBS News|url=https://www.cbsnews.com/news/biden-cabinet-final-picks-pressure-intensifies/|access-date=December 3, 2020}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|last=Rayasam|first=Renuka|date=December 2, 2020|title=Something Trump and Biden agree on|work=Politico|url=https://www.politico.com/newsletters/politico-nightly/2020/12/02/something-trump-and-biden-agree-on-491035|access-date=December 3, 2020}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|last=Abraham|first=Yvonne|date=December 3, 2020|title=Rhode Island Governor Gina Raimondo reportedly being considered for Health and Human Services Secretary|work=The Boston Globe|url=https://www.bostonglobe.com/2020/12/02/nation/governor-gina-raimondo-reportedly-being-considered-health-human-services-secretary/|access-date=December 3, 2020}}</ref> However, on December 6, it was announced that Biden intended to nominate California Attorney General [[Xavier Becerra]] for the position. ''[[Politico]]'' subsequently reported that Raimondo was unwilling to move to [[Washington, D.C.]] for the post, but had earlier expressed interest in being considered for [[United States Secretary of the Treasury|secretary of the treasury]] or [[United States Secretary of Commerce|secretary of commerce]].<ref>{{cite news|url = https://www.politico.com/news/2020/12/06/xavier-becerra-health-human-services-443356|title = Biden selects Becerra to lead Health and Human Services|work = [[Politico]]|date = December 6, 2020|access-date = December 6, 2020|last1 = Pager|first1 = Tyler|last2 = Cancryn|first2 = Adam|last3 = Ollstein|first3 = Alice Miranda}}</ref> On January 8, 2021, [[Presidential transition of Joe Biden|The Biden-Harris Transition]] team announced that President Elect Biden would nominate Raimondo as the Secretary of Commerce, pending Senate confirmation.<ref>{{Cite web|title=Governor Gina Raimondo, Secretary of Commerce|url=https://buildbackbetter.gov/nominees-and-appointees/gina-raimondo/|access-date=2021-01-08|website=President-Elect Joe Biden|language=en-US}}</ref>

title: Gina Raimondo
added: On March 1st, 2021, the Senate voted 84-15 in favor of cloture on the nomination, and confirmed Raimondo to the position the following day by a vote of 84-15 on March 2, 2021. |title=Senate vote moves Raimondo closer to Cabinet confirmation|url=https://www.providencejournal.com/story/news/politics/2021/03/01/us-sen-reed-raimondo-confirmation-vote-likely-tuesday/6868264002/|access-date=2021-03-02|website=The Providence Journal|language=en}}</ref>

title: Gina Raimondo
added: On March 1st, 2021, the Senate voted 84-15 in favor of cloture on the nomination, and confirmed Raimondo to the position the following day by a vote of 84-15 on March 2, 2021.<ref>{{Cite web|date=2021-03-01|title=Senate vote moves Raimondo closer to Cabinet confirmation|url=https://www.providencejournal.com/story/news/politics/2021/03/01/us-sen-reed-raimondo-confirmation-vote-likely-tuesday/6868264002/|access-date=2021-03-02|website=The Providence Journal|language=en}}</ref>

title: Gina Raimondo
added: On March 1st, 2021, the Senate voted 84-15 in favor of cloture on the nomination, and confirmed Raimondo to the position the following day by a vote of 84-15 on March 2, 2021.<ref>{{Cite web|date=2021-03-01|title=Senate vote moves Raimondo closer to Cabinet confirmation|url=https://www.providencejournal.com/story/news/politics/2021/03/01/us-sen-reed-raimondo-confirmation-vote-likely-tuesday/6868264002/|access-date=2021-03-02|website=The Providence Journal|language=en}}</ref>
